inn1.comm: starts outside off stump, Warner thinks about having a dip at it but ends up pulling the bat inside the line
tucks this off the pads straight to midwicket
plays from the crease at quite a full delivery, takes an inside to square leg...Warner wanted the single but was sent back
good length outside off, hint of shape back into Warner who defends into the covers
turned nicely off middle stump wide of mid-on and that will calm Warner
adjusts straight away to the right, outside off stump and Ponting shoulders arms
just a hint of width and Warner takes advantage with a strong square drive...the ball flies away at this ground, like in Johannesburg
back of a length, closer to off stump, defended to the off side
touch of extra bounce and Warner takes his bottom hand off the bat as he plays to the leg side
certainly not pitching full to Warner early on and he again defends off the back foot
short of a length outside off and left alone
nips back at Warner who works it behind square leg on the leg side so Ponting still won't have strike
this is fuller from Steyn and Warner leans into a well-timed drive but picks out mid-off
dispatched through the covers, it was a wide half volley and Warner was able to free his arms with a booming drive
drags the length back, punched off the back foot and well fielded at cover
that's a costly delivery, Steyn oversteps and strays onto the pads where Warner clips him away to fine leg
sends down a big full toss which is hammered straight down the ground...it didn't actually come out of the middle, but didn't matter
that's a comeback! Steyn strikes. Back on a good length, draws Warner onto the front foot and there's a hint of swing into the left hander which takes the inside edge into leg stump
short one to start with and Clarke defends on the back foot
pushed across outside off, Ponting makes a big strike forward and defends to the covers
short of a length outside off, Ponting hops back but doesn't time his shot into the covers
movement for Tsotsobe, this nips back into Ponting who leaves it alone and is taken in the stomach
good stuff from Tsotsobe, this one is fuller and draws Ponting forward finding an inside edge as he defends. Worth a short leg?
goes across the crease outside off and defends back to the bowler
undoes a good over by releasing the pressure, full on middle stump and Ponting flicks it away through midwicket
full on off stump, Clarke defends on the walk
nicely driven square of the wicket and a sharp piece of fielding at point
too straight and clipped away through midwicket
width outside off this time, and too short, allows Clarke to punch it off the back foot through the covers...pretty wayward start from Steyn
on leg stump again, easy for Clarke as he whips it through square leg...the scoreboard is rattling along
swinging away outside off, Clarke isn't interested and leaves alone...12 off the over is plenty
full outside off, Ponting comes forward and plays to cover
driven into the off side from the front foot...he's very keen to play forward
touch of extra bounce this time and it's a little awkward for Ponting because he's coming so far forwrd
finds the edge, but it flies through about fifth slip. It climbed a touch off a length and Ponting was still playing forward
defended square into the off side...Clarke, meanwhile, is playing from the crease
onto the front foot this time, defended solidly towards mid-off
starts off with a short ball which is pulled away through square leg with ease
back of a length outside off, punched firmly into the covers where Steyn parries it but it doesn't cost anything
close! Finds the inside edge and it flies past the out-stretched left hand of Mark Boucher...he got a fingertip on it, mighty tough as he had to change direction
driven off a thick outside edge down to third man
he's almost caught on the crease, was quite a full delivery and Ponting would have been well forward to that
left alone outside off
onto the front foot as he defends to the off side
on leg stump, tucked off the hip into the gap at square leg
hits him! Clarke is taken on the helmet by a short ball, he went for pull but was beaten for pace and appeared to get a little top edge on it, too
follows up with a delivery full on middle, Clarke responds with a confident defensive shot back to the bowler
takes the inside edge into the leg side
back of a length, Ponting jumps into his defensive shot and plays to the off side
outside off and left alone
touch wider outside off and Clarke doesn't play
short of a length outside off, defended off the back foot into the covers
defended square into the off side
this one is a little fuller and doesn't bring a shot from Clarke...a tempting line and being resisted so far
full on off stump, driven firmly down to mid-on and it's the first maiden of the match
this delivery keeps Ponting on the back foot as he defends into the covers
a touch of movement gets Ponting into a tangle as he tries to work this through the leg side
back outside off, played square on the off side

big appeal for lbw! South Africa think it's pad first before Ponting punches it to mid-off. There are reviews in this series, one for each side, but Amla decides against it. Would have been a good one for Hot Spot
now he goes for a pull and doesn't connect, this is good stuff from Tsotsobe who is causing problems
again a loose ball ends the over as Ponting pulls it away to fine leg
on off stump and defended to cover
full outside off, Clarke goes for a drive but doesn't time it cleanly
short ball outside off, Clarke lowers his bat and hands out of the line
another full delivery outside off, driven sweetly to mid-off
throws his arms through a drive this time, it was very wide and the ball went in the air through cover out to the sweeper
jumps back into the crease and nudges this from around off stump to the leg side
and he's bang on target to start, firing one down on a length outside off. Ponting lunges forward to defend

he's knocked him off his feet! Morkel spears in an unexpected full delivery, striking Ponting on the pad and knocking his legs out from underneath him. There's an appeal for lbw, but that was going down leg

another appeal! Again Morkel sprays this a little too far down the leg side, but it touches something on the way through. The South Africans think its glove/bat, but the umpire insists it was only pad. And he's right, by the looks of things

a rising delivery outside off is punched firmly to cover point in typically bellicose style by Ponting, but Duminy scoots across and slides to cut it off cleanly. Duminy has really settled in in that position
short of length again, but a little straighter this time and Ponting works a single wide of mid on
Clarke stands at the crease to tap a length delivery back to the bowler
chopped down on the off side, just the one
a hacked drive played with a horizontal bat flies out to deep cover, where there's protection on the rope
pitched full and wide by Kallis, and Ponting eases a drive to cover
slashed square! Again Clarke had to stretch out to drive but this time played it a little later to pick the gap
nurdled into the off side for one
this might've been an offcutter from Kallis. It kept a little low and moved in off the pitch, Ponting inside edging an attempted glance onto his pad
Morne roars an appeal! That's highly optimistic, despite the sharp seam movement in off the pitch. It's hit him about a foot outside off

Ponting dispatches a short ball to long leg with a cracking swivel-pull! That was sweetly timed, it never got up high but bounced just once before crossing the boundary. The old man's still got it ...
Morkel pushes his line a little wider of off, and Ponting steps across to shoulder arms
Morkel's a bit all over the place at the moment. This one is pushed too far down the leg side, and called wide

in the air! Morkel pitched one up and lured Ponting into a drive. It wasn't quite close enough to him for the shot, however, and he couldn't keep the square drive down, the ball shooting just past a leaping Duminy
Morkel zones in on the top of off, Ponting defends
slapped on the up to extra cover, where a good sliding stop saves runs
tossed up on middle and leg, tucked to midwicket
Clarke is down the track but Botha spots him coming and drags his length back, drawing a defensive stroke from the batsman
a touch too straight from the offspinner, and Clarke finds the gap at square leg
quicker and flatter through the air from Botha, but it's dragged down short and Ponting eases a single to leg
good stuff from Clarke, getting deep in the crease and placing the ball square for another single
pushed through flat and aimed right at middle, Ponting getting forward to defend to midwicket

great reflexes from Faf du Plessis! He in close at a short cover point and Clarke absolutely murdered a cut to his left, but Faf thrust both hands out to stop it cleanly. Much appreciated by the bowler
worked away for a quiet single
nicely full from Morkel, and the line is good too. Ponting comes forward in defence
yet again Morne is saved by his fielders. He offered plenty of width on the length delivery but the man at extra cover stops the shot
played a little loosely by Ponting, the veteran batsman slicing at a rising delivery to play it to backward point
good end to the over, Morkel aiming at the top of middle and Ponting tapping tamely to mid on
a twinklet-toed Clarke greets Botha's first ball after the interval with a quick shuffle down the track, but he doesn't quite get to it
hurled down quicker and flatter, and after coming down Clarke double-bluffs the bowler by stepping deep into his crease to work a single into the leg side
has he got bat on this? Botha gave this one a lot more air but looped it down the leg side, and Ponting just needed a thin glance to get it to the fine leg boundary
Botha reverts to type, sending this one down much flatter, and Ponting defends to leg
aimed at middle and leg, Ponting turns his wrists over it but can't find the gap
but this time he does, a single coming through square leg
flighted up on off stump, Clarke comes forward in defence
slapped behind square, on the up but straight to the fielder
though his direction has been off, Morkel has hit the seam consistently in this spell and does so once again, jagging one in to Ponting and taking the inside edge
a splice-jarring delivery is pushed to cover. There's pace and bounce for Morkel, as you'd expect, but nothing too dramatic
a well played shot for just one run, Ponting stepping confidently forward and driving wide of mid off. Amla sprinted to his left and tumbled into a sliding stop to keep him to just one
rising off a length and nicely straight from the tall fast bowler, Clarke tapping defensively to mid on. Morkel held that one across the seam, looking for extra bounce

imperious! The bounce in this track is very consistent, and so the batsmen have the confidence to play shots like these. Morkel offered width outside off, but the length was tricky - middling. Clarke made the most of it, however, hammering the ball square of the wicket with his weight forward
he is on target with the loosener, keeping Ponting quiet with a length delivery on middle and off

edged to third man! There is a slip in place but this was far too wide for him. Ponting was aiming for a backfoot punch to cover, but Steyn shaped one away from him to take a healthy edge. Unfortunately for him, it flew at a catchable height through the vacant second/third slip area
much fuller and straighter, and cutting in off the wicket. Ponting spots the change-up and gets forward to defend to mid on
gentle shape away from the bat again. Tapped down defensively to cover point
Steyn pushes Clarke deep into his crease with a short-of-length delivery that is defended into the off side
whipped off the pads, the ball rolling behind square on the leg side
work off the hip to square leg
outside off stump and heaved along the ground to midwicket
comes well outside off stump, plays with the spin into the leg side and wanted a single but was sent back by Clarke and had to scurry
lovely shot, a hint of width and Ponting glides it through the vacant slip area down to third man
drilled into the leg side wide of long on
connects well with a sweep, takes it from well outside off stump, it goes in the air but clear of any fielders. That takes him to fifty
gives himself a touch of room outside leg then slashes down to third man
nearly does Ponting with a slower bounce, it looped off the surface and he had to wait on the shot before pulling to midwicket
back of a length, flat-batted back past the bowler put without much timing so mid-off comes round
opens the face and pushes into the off side
he's middle that! Dropped in short, Clarke was hanging back waiting for it and latches on with a powerful. He didn't even try to keep it down
and again! He's peppering the leg side, this time it's straighter and more over midwicket as he clears his front leg
backing up, what a way to go! We've seen a few of these of late. Ponting used his feet, drilled it down the pitch where Botha got a hand on it and Clarke was backing up well out of his crease

almost another run out. Ponting open the face and found third man, Hussey races up the pitch and commits to a full-length dive. Boucher had knocked the bails off before getting the ball, but then uprooted a stump but Hussey was home
round the wicket, full on off stump, driven to cover
back in the crease and work off the stumps to deep square leg
chips down the pitch and works out to midwicket
lovely delivery, beaten by turn and bounce as this spins past the outside edge
driven on the up from off stump straight to cover
down the pitch and aims a heave to leg but loses shape on the shot so doesn't connect
length delivery which doesn't really come on to Ponting, he goes for a pull and it lobs towards midwicket
pinged away. Unlike Ponting, Hussey connects with his pull and it races through square leg
beaten! That had some pace on it. Good comeback from Morkel. Hussey tries to run it down to third man but is done by the bounce
fuller and driven square into the off side
round the wicket, worked off the stumps out to deep midwicket
down the pitch and thumped to long off
brilliant from Hussey, comes down the pitch and outside leg which opens up the off side and he drives it over the deep cover boundary
fired in quicker, full at the stumps, and tucked out to deep square leg
backs away to leg but Botha followed him and fired the ball at his feet which meant there was no room to swing the arms
full again, yorker length and squeezed out to deep cover
down the leg side, no touch on the pad so no escape for the bowler
opens the face and plays to cover
he's found the non-striker's stumps again, but this time without any touch from the bowler, and it deflects away wide of mid-on for a single...the shot was worth a boundary
another short ball and Hussey likes them, he managed to control the shot even though it was around head-height and there's no one at long leg
goes back to a full length on the stumps, Hussey opens the face to find third man
a fairly ugly shot from Ponting as he carves this down to long off
delicately glided down to third man using the pace of Morkel
gets past the edge straight away as the ball bounces over Hussey's cut
full on middle and leg, nicely timed through midwicket but the fielding is swift to stop a second
full at the stumps, whipped down to long on
low full toss on off stump, Hussey drives firmly to cover where Morkel gets down well to make a good save
comes down the pitch outside leg then doesn't connect as the ball is outside off stump
aims down the ground but it comes off the toe end and lobs into the outfield short of long on
starts with a good yorker but it's pushed down the ground with just the right amount of force to allow time for a second
picks out backward point. It was full and wide, Ponting connected quite well but Botha didn't have to move too far to his right
slashes and misses at his first ball, wasn't far away from a wide but Haddin was giving himself room
splays his stance to allow himself a free swing then drives a very full delivery down to long off
tucked off about middle towards square leg
some excellent timing, again staying leg-side of the ball and drives sweetly through cover leaving long off a chase around the boundary
this is a super little innings from Hussey as he picks up another boundary over midwicket from a full delivery
now he drives firmly through the covers
low full toss at leg stump, pushed down the ground and again with just the right amount of force
this is on a good length so Haddin is able to get slightly under it and swing into the leg side
another full toss which is heaved through midwicket, there's a good piece of fielding on the boundary as JP Duminy brings out the slide
lofted down to long on, got underneath this too much and it almost went straight up
drives his first delivery firmly down to long where's a fumble so he gets back on strike
excellent yorker outside off stump and Marsh plays over the top
low full toss and Marsh swings powerfully through the line to pick out long off
well bowled, Hussey shaped to move outside leg and Steyn fired the ball full at his pads and it rebounded down to third man
connects cleanly through the off side, was short of yorker length and Marsh could drive with a full swing of the arms
gets the final ball of the innings down to third man

inn2.comm: swing straight away as this shapes away from Smith who leaves alone

back of a length and tucked off the hip into the leg side...oh dear, they end up getting four runs! There was all sorts of pinball played with the fielding and it was Ponting, backing up a poor initial throw, who then gave away the overthrows with a throw past the non-striker's stumps
short delivery but Smith doesn't time his pull as he finds mid-on
tucked to square leg
gone! Bollinger wins the battle again, Smith plays across the line and is given lbw. Smith considers a review but after asking Amla he walks off. It looked out.
tight run to start with, pushed into the covers and he would have made it even with a direct hit so well judged
hint of swing into Kallis who tucks this off the pads past square leg
punched off the back foot into the covers
pushes at this off the back foot and it comes off a thick edge down to third man
well bowled, nipped back of a length into Kallis who gets an inside edge into his leg
another super delivery, encouraging signs for Johnson as he gets this to swing back late into Kallis and he's taken on the pads but quite high
loses his line down the leg side, that will happen with Johnson
beaten outside off as he drives over a very full delivery...decent opening over from Johnson to keep the pressure on
a solid drive into the off side but can't find the gap
banged in short, Amla goes for the pull and it doesn't come out of the middle but it has enough to clear square leg and fall safely
that's a wonderful shot, picks up a short ball off leg stump and lofts it onto the grass banks behind long leg...all timing that shot, not brute force
good comeback from Bollinger, responds with a full delivery outside off and Kallis is slightly flat-footed as he plays and misses with a drive
good pace and line, outside off, which is left alone
and he beats him again, this time a length delivery that seams past the outside edge with Kallis on the back foot
full and searching for the swing, Amla plays it well with a straight bat back to the bowler who parries it to mid-off
slung outside off but just inside the markers that the umpires use to judge a wide call
that's a ripper! Zips back off a good length and cuts Amla in half as it beats the inside edge
now Amla dishes it out as he launches a full, wide delivery in the air over cover. He threw everything at that
more swing for Johnson, comes back into Amla and beats him for pace as he tries to play to leg
extra bounce takes Amla on the thigh pad as he jumps into line
back of a length, Kallis just opens the face a touch and plays a controlled shot to third man
full outside off stump, Amla plays a punchy drive which goes straight to a square cover
stays full looking for movement and it's nicely driven up to mid-off
plays from the crease this time into the off side
now he goes short, it's over off stump and beats Amla's attempted to glide it over the slips...it certainly wasn't trying to keep it down
pushed into the covers off the back foot and it's a well-judged single
and his first ball in ODI cricket is upper cut for six over cover...it wasn't a shocking delivery, but offered enough width for the shot which Amla played with conviction
this one is driven sweetly off the back foot straight cover
full at off stump, dug out towards the bowler who collects in his follow through
another lovely shot, driven on the up square through the off side. It pierced a small gap between backward point and square cover
responds in typical fast-bowler style with a bouncer which follows Amla who, again, tries to go over the slips but doesn't make contact
driven up to mid-off
short and wide but he gets away with it as Kallis cuts to point
driven down to long off
pushed through quite flat, Amla opens the face to find the gap at cover
hammered! Too much width and Kallis unfurls a powerful cover drive that reached the boundary before anyone blinked
touch short again, Kallis drives off the back foot to the cover sweeper
cut backward of square and deep cover does well to keep them to a single
back of a length outside off and Amla punches into the off side
fuller this time, driven firmly towards mid-off but they can still scamper a single
big wicket! Cummins keeps taking wickets. It was full outside off, Kallis went for a drive and got a thick inside into the stumps. Not a bad scalp to start your ODI career with
just gets this slightly too straight, on middle and leg, which allows Duminy a neat clip through square leg
gone! He's got Duminy again. He was trying to pull his bat away from the delivery outside off, but it was too late and it ran off the face to second slip who held a sharp catch.
that's an emphatic way to get off the mark as he drives a full delivery through straight mid-off, but it doesn't take anything away from a fine over by Cummins
cuts square on the off side and it almost carries to point
plays this neatly off the back foot towards point
comes forward and works it past a diving midwicket
width again to Amla who cuts it out to deep cover
onto the front foot, driven through the off side
better line on middle and it's defended down the pitch
starts outside off and it's left alone
uses his feet, goes across the crease and little towards the bowler then tucks into the leg side
takes advantage of some width and guides it fine of third man but Bollinger slides well
chases a wide delivery and is beaten. No footwork and he reached for the ball

another one goes! And with a fine catch. South Africa falling apart. Was full and fairly wide, Amla chased it and got an edge through to Brad Haddin who took a super catch, one-handed, diving in front of first slip
tucks his first ball through square leg
squirted off the outer half of the bat, Miller angling the blade as he presses forward to get it to short third man
swept hard out to deep midwicket, but the fielder is round in time to cut it off
chopped down on the off side for one
looped up on middle and leg, worked off the pads
Doherty comes round the wicket to du Plessis, who flicks a very full ball off the toes and down to short fine leg
speared in flat and full by Doherty, hoping to slip one under the bat. Miller jabs down in time, however, and finds a single to long on
shovelled off the pads, the ball rolling out to long leg
Faf angles his bat to work the ball through backward point
punched towards mid-off, who is very deep and so a single is on offer
worked into the leg side for a single
Marsh aims for the swinging yorker but it slips out as a full toss that is tapped wide of midwicket
chipped in the air to wide long on. Deliberately played, the ball falling well short of the fielder
drilled hard at mid-off
threaded through cover for one
Faf hops down the wicket but Xavier spots him coming, dragging his length down to draw a hurried defence
pushed down the ground
fetched across to deep midwicket, where there's plenty of cover

was this a catch? Miller stepped away and drove hard square of the wicket, the ball landing in point's waiting hands. But was it a bump ball? Doherty appeals but the umpire's not convinced. Eventually they go upstairs, and that's out!
wobbling around off a good length, just outside off. Faf defends down to gully
good shot for one run! du Plessis leans forward to slap a drive to deep extra cover
full and straight, driven back to the bowler
a bouncer from Marsh, and though it's not particularly lethal Boucher opts to sway cautiously out of the way
a touch straight, and Boucher works him off the pads
shot! Faf du Plessis has shown remarkable poise and timing so far in this knock. He uses his feet to good effect, and a powerful drive threads the men at cover and mid-off

there's an appeal from Doherty as Boucher misses a flick to leg and is hit on the pads, but it's quickly quashed. How close was this? Doherty doesn't look that confident, but Clarke wants to review it. Yep, it pitched in line and would've taken out middle and leg, Boucher is out!
solid forward defence first up
he sweeps right over the top of one! Botha bent down and tried to smash, but couldn't get anything on it
beaten slashing outside off now! Botha thought the cut was on. It wasn't
cracking delivery! Doherty is really putting pressure on Botha. This one was slower through the air, gripped on the greasy surface, and spun past the outside edge of his poking bat
flicked off the toes to midwicket, and they hurry back for the second
a late cut bounces down to third man

another appeal! Marsh nips one in off the seam, as he has done quite a bit on this tour already, and zipped between bat and pad. The Australians thought he got something on it, but it probably touched the back leg. There's no review
beaten outside off, on the cut! Botha is taking a while to settle out there
full and straight, Botha coming forward with bat and pad together in defence
dropped by Cummins at mid on! It was such an easy chance too. Botha was rushed into a pull and the ball popped tamely to mid on. He got there in good time but it hit the palm and popped straight out
tapped to cover point, on the up, for a quick single
Botha uses his feet well to get right to the pitch and smash a drive, but unfortunately for him he hits it straight at the fielder
and now he's just about swung himself off his feet attempting a mow to leg. He recovers in time to take the single
Faf skips down and collects a single to long on
Botha is living dangerously! He charges the bowler and tries to go over long on, but can't get a good connection. In fact, he hits it so badly that it falls in front of the fielder, saving him
a misfield by Smith at deep cover allows four! The ball was driven very hard out into that region, but he just over-ran it
driven down to long off for one
and he starts with a horrid wide miles outside off

Faf goes on the attack, but he slices across the attempted loft and the ball loops out to Mike Hussey at deep cover. South Africa sink further. They need to reach 172 by the 20th over to be par on D/L now
flapped across the line towards mid on, where the fielder slips on the outfield and allows a single
the bouncer rises up past the grille of the batsman, who sways out of the way
Steyn rides the bounce of another short delivery to defend to point
chopped down to third man for one
hammered down the ground! Botha takes South Africa to 99 with a drilled straight drive
he slams one down short of a good length to start, Steyn tapping to gully
there's a speculative appeal from Bollinger as Steyn is struck on the pad, but this landed well outside leg and the end result is a scampered leg bye
Botha is starting to middle a few now! But is it too little too late? The ball was short once again, and Botha's pull beat the man at short fine leg
Botha walks right across his stumps and shovels a drive hard at mid on
straight down the ground! Four more for Botha. This was a quality cricket shot. He picked up the length delivery and lifted it straight back over Bollinger's head
Botha on the attack! More length from Bollinger and it's disappeared over wide long on for six. Do South Africa still have a chance? Rusty and Waleed will say they do!
Steyn doesn't come close to laying bat on ball with a flatfooted swish outside off
Johnson pushes this one slightly wider on the angle across the left-hander, who misses with the cut this time
Steyn will keep swinging! He has another go and this time finds the middle, flat-batting a length delivery over mid on after clearing the left leg

Steyn perishes in search of runs! Johnson pulled his length back and Steyn slashed hard into an uppercut, but could only spoon the ball down to Bollinger at third man. Good catch by the lanky fast bowler, and South Africa lose another one
beaten by the bounce as he tries to cut through the off side
heaves a full delivery into the leg side but can't beat a diving mid-on

he's trodden on his stumps! Cummins has his third. Early in his career to get a hit wicket. Botha went back and across then pulled a short ball away, but the in process of playing the stroke his back foot when into the base of stumps
short of a length and it's well played as he defends behind the line
that's an excellent short ball, targets Tsotsobe's throat and he does well to play it down in front of gully
that's a quick one but it's too short and climbs clear of the batsman and the keeper
well done by the No. 11. Cummins followed up with a full delivery but Tsotsobe drove it straight down the ground even though he was quite behind the line
slower ball outside off which is steered into the off side
back of a length, defended towards gully to end a rapid over
full at off stump, hint of shape away to Morkel who drives to cover
touch shorter and this time it's nicely punched off the back foot wide of cover
pushed across outside off stump, Tsotsobe stands still and doesn't play a shot
goes full at the stumps and it's driven to cover
short delivery, Tsotsobe drops his hands and lets it go over the stumps
that's the game! Tsotsobe tries to launch this down the ground but only manages to send it straight up in the air and Marsh steadied himself under the catch back-tracking from mid-off
